title: Classical Sorting Algorithms as a Model of Morphogenesis: self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in a minimal model of basal intelligence. (arXiv:2401.05375v1 [cs.NE])
abstract: The emerging field of Diverse Intelligence seeks to identify, formalize, and understand commonalities in behavioral competencies across a wide range of implementations. Especially interesting are simple systems that provide unexpected examples of memory, decision-making, or problem-solving in substrates that at first glance do not appear to be complex enough to implement such capabilities. We seek to develop tools to help understand the minimal requirements for such capabilities, and to learn to recognize and predict basal forms of intelligence in unconventional substrates. translated_title: 经典排序算法作为一种形态发生学模型：自排序数组在极简模型的基础智能中展现了意外的能力
translated_abstract: 多样化智能领域旨在识别、正式化和理解各种实现中行为能力的共性。尤其有趣的是那些在外观上看起来不够复杂以实现这些能力的基质中提供了意外的记忆、决策或问题解决的简单系统。我们致力于开发工具来帮助理解实现这些能力的最小要求，并学习识别和预测非传统基质中基本智力形式。在这里，我们对经典排序算法的行为应用了新颖的分析方法，这些算法是长期以来被研究的短代码片段。为了将这些排序算法作为生物形态发生学及其能力模型进行研究，我们打破了两个先前普遍存在的假设：自上而下控制（而是展示了数字数组中的每个元素如何施加最小的主动性并实现排序策略）。
tldr: 该论文研究了经典排序算法作为形态发生学模型，在极简模型中展示出了意外的基础智能能力。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates classical sorting algorithms as a model of morphogenesis, revealing unexpected basal intelligence capabilities in a minimal model.
